turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: Where do you think this goes?

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: This ocean business...  I know where I can find a map.  I need to go back to the station.  Where will you be?

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: I'm on the serial killer case, need to talk.

turns.speaker: THOMPSON
turns.text: They've taken my mind, my memories...

turns.speaker: THOMPSON
turns.text: Is that your idea of a joke?  I don't remember...  Take my advice, Bumstead.  Get off this case.  Now.

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Jesus!  We have to get you to a doctor...

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: But...  How long has this been happening?

turns.speaker: THOMPSON
turns.text: A few days...  a few weeks  -  dunno, I can't remember.  Worse thing is, I never know if it will change back again...  Now, please leave me alone.

turns.speaker: KARL
turns.text: Look!  This is a good one!

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: There.  Behind the cabinet.  Where does it go?

turns.speaker: KARL
turns.text: Such a joker!  Like your father.

turns.speaker: KARL
turns.text: It must be a closet or something.

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: Everyone has a job  -  a function.  Each one teaches you more about your invention.  I'm what is called a <u>murderer</u>.

turns.speaker: MISTER BLACK
turns.text: A book of delusions.  Anything else?

turns.speaker: MISTER BLACK
turns.text: Shut up, freak!  Monster!  You are insignificant.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: Then we must call the police.

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: No.  I mean...  that isnít necessary.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: I see.  Then who is after you?  What sins have you committed?

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: Just let me sit here for a moment? Iíll go soon, and stop bothering you.

turns.speaker: SCHREBER
turns.text: You remember nothing?  Who you are? What you've done?

turns.speaker: SCHREBER
turns.text: Ah, that would be cheating, wouldn't it?  Is there nothing <u>you</u> remember?  Not even a detail?   You must try.

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: You think I haven't been trying!  It's like there was never anything there.  Just water.

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: Waves...  A beach.  A woman whispering.  That's all.  I need to stay awake.  Do you have any pills?

turns.speaker: SCHREBER
turns.text: What does she say?  The woman.

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: Asks my name.  Over and over.  Just like a broken record.  Only thing is, I can't answer.  I've no idea what my name <u>is</u>.

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: That's what people keep telling me.

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: You're supposed to be my doctor, right?

turns.speaker: SCHREBER
turns.text: I cannot say...  You don't know the answer to that?

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: I told you, I can't remember a thing!

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: Did she drown?  The woman you told me about?

turns.speaker: SCHREBER
turns.text: Not exactly.  She was found in a canal, disembowelled.  Throat cut. Blood drained.  The body wrapped in a bed-sheet.

turns.speaker: SCHREBER
turns.text: You remember nothing, eh?  Let me show you something.

turns.speaker: SCHREBER
turns.text: We are little more than a sum of memories.  From them we reference who we are, where we're going.  Without a past we are nothing.  This is why you are so interesting.

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: Can I get my life back?

turns.speaker: SCHREBER
turns.text: I don't blame you for getting angry. You are in a frustrating situation. You must be patient though.  Trust me completely.  I'm here to help.

turns.speaker: SCHREBER
turns.text: You can't go yet.  We've got so much to talk about...

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: So you're telling me the truth <u>this</u> time?  Is that it!

turns.speaker: SCHREBER
turns.text: If you would only take this, inject it in your brain, everything would be much clearer.

turns.speaker: SCHREBER
turns.text: Everyone get's one  -  very much like this...  But this one's special.  It will help you understand, everything...

turns.speaker: SCHREBER
turns.text: Please!  Don't be foolish!  Time is short.  Let me show you something. Look at this syringe.

turns.speaker: SCHREBER
turns.text: Don't ask stupid questions.  Look at it.

turns.speaker: SCHREBER
turns.text: No it isn't.  <u>You</u> are doing it!  Now raise it over the glass and...

turns.speaker: SCHREBER
turns.text: We are...  living in their dreams...

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: I thought it would make more sense. I'm getting the pieces, but when I put it together it feels like... Like you're telling me about somebody else's life...

turns.speaker: WIFE
turns.text: It's the truth...  I need you.  I know you're innocent.

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: How do you know I'm innocent?

turns.speaker: WIFE
turns.text: Of course you are.  You couldn't do those terrible things.  Come home with me  -  maybe things will make sense then...

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: I can't do that.  It's dangerous. What about my parents?  Do you know where I can find them?

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: How do I get there?  Tell me.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: You understand what you'll be doing?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Yeah... You just want me to wave, right?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Wave from the door... go down the stairs... get into the limo...

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: `Cause you know I can do other stuff. I mean,  if you wanted me to talk or...

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: How much do you usually get paid?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Uh -- I don't know.   Sometimes it's just like a barter thing...  Is this legal?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Don't worry.  You won't even see her.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: It happens.  This is where you'll be sleeping.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: We'll be back for you first thing tomorrow and if you need me for anything, Duane will be right outside the door.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Okay, let's go over it again. You met a girl, you fell in love...

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: And we're going away for a holiday.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: First thing we're gonna work on is the mannerisms.  Alan has put together sort of a training program

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Oh, sure.  Remember the convention speech?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: It's in the little leaguer who may strike out but knows in his heart that at least swung...  Hands to the side...

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Be a professional. If you can convince her - - you can convince anybody.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Now when she comes in, we'll move you right out to the balcony.  All you have to say is  `thanks for doing this, Ellen.'

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: I mean,  if it's a problem...

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: That shelter was in this bill.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Lots of shelters were in this bill.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Uh, Mr. President... I don't believe that's on your agenda today.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Well it's a last minute change.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Yes, Bob.   Choices... Now the Commerce Department..,

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: What do you think you're doing?!

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: You mean the press conference?  I have a couple of ideas I wanted to share with the country.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: You're nothing.  Do you understand me! You're NOBODY...

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: You're lint!  You're a flea!  You're a blip!

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Well, maybe I am.  But you're fired.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: I said you're fired.  Go on -- get outta here.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: I'm the President and as they say 'The buck stops here.'  So I take full responsibility for every one of my illegal acts.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: They say it hit both sides of his brain... Even if he makes it he's gonna be a vegetable.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I can't believe he'd do this.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: She's a little hysterical right now. We've got her upstairs in a laundry room.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Look... at some point we're going to have to call the Vice President...

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: The guy's in a coma, Bob.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: This is mine, Al -- all mine ... I made him. I built him.  And no cocksucker is gonna come in here and take it away from me just because he to be Vice President of the United States!

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Bob, the guy had a stroke!

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Look, everything can be handled.  We'll just find a way to handle it.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Well, start by going on television and saying that he's had a mild stroke...

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Yes - - and that he ought to be up and around sometime soon.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Do you know how many different kinds of laws we've broken?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: It's simple, Alan.  We send the Vice- President to Africa or something, dig up some dirt on him, force him to resign and get our `President' to nominate a new one.  The whole thing takes a few weeks tops.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: You mean we get `Dave' to nominate you as Vice President.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I was a senator, you know.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Oh, I know. And then when our poor President gets another stroke - - of course much more serious this time - - the newly appointed V.P. becomes the Pres...

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: I got the nurses for fifty grand a piece and the doctors for a hundred. The older one wanted head of the CDC.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Duane's guys, but he's got them under control.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Her?... Oh -- the First Lady...  She was giving that commencement speech up in Bryn Mawr.  I managed to catch her before she left the hotel.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: I told her his blood pressure went up after a little incident at  `the hotel.' She seems to hate him more than ever.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Everybody else is buying the minor stroke'  story...

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I just hope this yutz can pull it off.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: What do you mean, he's clean?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: I mean I've checked everything. Women.  Liquor... Finances.  I went all the way back to his high school race for student body president.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: No one gets to be Vice President by being that clean.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: The guy's a Boy Scout, Bob.  He declared frequent flyer miles on his income tax return.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: We've got nothing, Bob.  This won't work.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: If we find nothing, we get creative. Just make something up.  Instead of a couple weeks it'll be a couple of months.  The whole thing is under control.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: You think we can keep this thing going for a couple of months!

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Okay, let's see... you can have him on Tuesday the 25th...

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Are you out of your mind?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Uh, let me get back to you...

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: You scheduled a whole day with the First Lady?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: It's gonna be great.  'Caring about his wife.'  'Spending time on her favorite issue...'

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I don't want him caring about his wife! What about the Vice President!

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Remember that First Liberty stuff we almost got nailed on?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Couple of days.  Anyhow, look at these tracking polls, they'll burn up in your hands: seventy- three percent with seniors, eighty- four with working mothers...

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Alan, we still have to control this guy...

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: And look at this.  Russell came around on the trade bill.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: How long have you been waiting to pass that thing?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: I'm telling you, Bob,  it's a gift. When you got a Ferrari you don't leave it in the garage.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Dave, these things get awfully complicated sometimes...

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Hundredth cabinet meeting.  I thought it was a nice touch.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Do we have anything on the budget today?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: He's not a President! He's an ordinary person.  I can kill an ordinary person.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I can kill a HUNDRED ordinary people.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: He's only doing what you told him to.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: I heard you.  You said 'cut three hundred million dollars from the federal budget, and you can keep your homeless shelter.'

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Well, I didn't mean it, Alan. Why the fuck would I want to save a homeless shelter?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: He was only doing his job.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: It's not his job -- It's my job!

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Was he a senator? Is he on the Trilateral Commission? Was he in Who's Who In Washington NINE YEARS Reed wrestles him away from the door, as Bob struggles to get free.  I'll destroy him, Alan. I'll shred the bastard!!!

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I'll lock him away for good.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Then we'll all go to jail together.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: What do you mean by that?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Just what you think I mean.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: ... But as I began to investigate, I realized that this pattern of corruption extended much higher...

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: So you want to go swimming?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Oh yeah... Me, too.  You want to get dinner later?

turns.speaker: MURRAY
turns.text: I was gonna do something with Joan.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Oh. Okay.  I'll catch ya tomorrow then.

turns.speaker: MURRAY
turns.text: I'm serious, Dave -- you could get in a lot of trouble for something like this.

turns.speaker: MURRAY
turns.text: They could put you in jail.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Why would they do that.  They hired me.

turns.speaker: MURRAY
turns.text: I gotta tell ya, Dave.  I've been going over this a bunch of times and a lot of this stuff just doesn't add up.  Who does these books?

turns.speaker: MURRAY
turns.text: I gotta tell ya, Dave.  I've been going over this a bunch of times and a lot of this stuff just doesn't add up.  Who does these books?

turns.speaker: MURRAY
turns.text: I just think they make this stuff a lot more complicated than it has to be.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: I'm not surprised.  Can we save anywhere?

turns.speaker: MURRAY
turns.text: Well, yeah.  But you gotta start making some choices.

turns.speaker: MURRAY
turns.text: You know -- priorities.  Remember when you couldn't get your car fixed `cause you wanted to get that piano?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: You could buy it on payments.

turns.speaker: MURRAY
turns.text: Yeah.  That's how you end up with a 400 billion dollar deficit.

turns.speaker: MURRAY
turns.text: Well, there's lots of places where I think you can save, but I'm not the one who's ....... I mean, I'm not the one who's not the Pres...

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: It's alright.  I know what you mean. Let's start at the top.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Thanks. You did great.  Maybe later you could come back and we could go to Camp David or something.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: You sure?  A Coke or a Perrier or something?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Now, Dave, something has come up and I think we need to talk about it...

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Look, I'm sorry.  I know you said not to talk, but when I saw the crowd I just got excited...

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: We're not upset with you, Dave.  We think you did a terrific job.  Don't we?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: In fact, we think you did such a good job, we'd like to extend things a little bit.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Extend them.  C'mere for a second.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: I know...  I know...  It's difficult for all of us.  But sometimes we have to put our personal feelings aside and focus on the gQod of the country.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Well, it's...  It's sort of an... an `incident'  really...

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: It's actually kind of serious, Dave. I'm afraid the President's not in very good shape.
